data.enText: food put on a hook to catch fish or in nets, traps, etc. to catch animals or birds
a person or thing that is used to catch sb or to attract them, for example to make them do what you want

data.chText: 下诱饵；在（鱼钩上、陷阱中等）放诱饵
data.enText: to place food on a hook, in a trap, etc. in order to attract or catch an animal

data.chText: 他在陷阱中放了一片肉做诱饵。
data.enText: He baited the trap with a piece of meat.
to deliberately try to make sb angry by making cruel or insulting remarks
the activity of attacking a wild animal with dogs

means: 在(鱼钩上、陷阱中等)放诱饵

ex.chText: 由于受到城市生活的诱惑，他离开了家。
ex.enText: He left home because of the lures of urban life.

ex.chText: 一个女人的诱惑让他不能自拔。
ex.enText: He was trapped by the lure of a woman.

synonyms.bx: 指具有吸引力的事物，也指诱惑力。

ex.enText: Worms work well as fishing bait.

ex.chText: 很多人受骗上当，把一生的积蓄都弄丢了。
ex.enText: Many people took the bait and lost their life savings.

synonyms.bx: 尤指用于引诱某人做某事或买某物的事物，也指钓鱼、猎兽等用的饵。

ex.chText: 敌军士兵被假目标诱入雷区。
ex.enText: The enemy soldiers were lured into a minefield by a decoy.

ex.chText: 警官南希充当诱饵来抓捕那名强奸犯。
ex.enText: Officer Nancy acted as a decoy to catch the rapist.

synonyms.bx: 指为抓捕、攻击某人等而引诱其至某地或做某事的人或事物。

ex.chText: 这显然是给他设下的陷阱。
ex.enText: It is clearly a snare for him.

ex.chText: 我可不想再落入同样的圈套。
ex.enText: I don't want to fall into the same snare again.

synonyms.bx: 指诱骗他人使其陷入困境的事物。

ex.chText: 警察设下圈套捉拿窃贼。
ex.enText: The police set a trap to catch the thief.

ex.chText: 布朗先生一下就落入了保守党布设的陷阱。
ex.enText: Mr. Brown walked straight into a trap laid by the Tories.

synonyms.bx: 指为抓捕某人或迫使某人听任摆布而设的圈套。

tr: something used to lure fish or other animals into danger so they can be trapped or killed
anything that serves as an enticement
harass with persistent criticism or carping
example: The children teased the new teacher
Don't ride me so hard over my failure
His fellow workers razzed him when he wore a jacket and tie

tr: attack with dogs or set dogs upon
lure, entice, or entrap with bait

value.def: Bait is food which you put on a hook or in a trap in order to catch fish or animals.
If you bait a hook or trap, you put bait on it or in it.

example.ex: He baited his hook with pie...
example.tran: 他在鱼钩上装了点馅饼作钓饵。

example.ex: The boys dug pits and baited them so that they could spear their prey.
example.tran: 男孩们挖了坑，埋了饵，这样他们就可以刺杀猎物了。

value.tran: 装饵于；给（鱼钩或陷阱等）上诱饵

value.def: To use something as bait means to use it to trick or persuade someone to do something.

example.ex: Service stations use petrol as a bait to lure motorists into the restaurants and other facilities...
example.tran: 加油站以汽油为诱饵，吸引开车的人用餐以及使用其他设施。

example.ex: Television programmes are essentially bait  to attract an audience for advertisements.
example.tran: 从根本上说，电视节目就是吸引观众看广告的诱饵。

value.def: If you bait someone, you deliberately try to make them angry by teasing them.

example.ex: He delighted in baiting his mother.

value.tran: 使上当发火；故意逗…生气

value.def: If you take the bait, you react to something that someone has said or done exactly as they intended you to do. The expression rise to the bait is also used, mainly in British English.

example.ex: When she attempts to make you feel guilty, don't  take the bait...
example.tran: 如果她试图让你觉得内疚，不要上当。

example.ex: Their behaviour may seem insulting, but it's important not to rise to the bait and get cross.
example.tran: 他们的行为看起来可能很无礼，但千万不要上当生气。

value.tran: 中圈套，上当，中计（亦作rise to the bait,主要用于英国英语中）

trans: 点击诱饵(指网站上诱导人们点击链接的内容)
中圈套，上当，中计（亦作rise to the bait,主要用于英国英语中）
